result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Will E Edwards

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from attorney Rud with attached correspondence from the defendant's doctor received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Michael Rud in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant not in court. Defense counsel advised the court the defendant is continuing to have medical problems but has not had any recent contact with him. State requested a warrant be issued. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Defendant must post $100.00 cash bail to be released from the warrant. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Attorney Michael Rud in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant not in court. Defendant recently had surgery and is unable to appear in court today. Documentation from Wheaton Franciscan regarding the surgery submitted by defense counsel received and filed. Court issued but STAYED a bench warrant until the next court date. Court granted defense request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Will E Edwards in court with attorney Michael Rud.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. On oral motion of the State, Court ordered the Party to a Crime modifier added to COUNT 1. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Defense counsel requested a restitution hearing. Court ordered sentencing adjourned to complete both the restitution hearing and sentencing on the same date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Will E Edwards in court with attorney Michael Rud.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in court on today's date.  Court withdrew the stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing before Branch 25.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Rud in court.  
Francesco Mineo for DeAnn Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Calendar call.  Defendant not present.  Letter from The Villa received and filed.  Defense request for continued stay of warrant heard and granted by the Court.  Defense to submit letter providing status as to defendant's condition on the next date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Rud in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel provided the court with a letter indicating that defendant is still in the hospital.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until June 30, 2015.  Court ordered defense counsel to have the doctor submit in writing defendant's prognosis ON LETTERHEAD.  Calendar call scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Rud in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp for Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informed the court defendant is unavailable for today's proceedings due to being in the in the hospital.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing. Should the warrant be enforced at the next court date, Court ordered any bail to be forfeited.    Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Will E Edwards in court with attorney Michael Rud.  Sara Schroeder for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Court allows defendant time for Scheduling Conference due to medical condition.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Anthony T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Letter from his doctor in regards to his foot wound. Received and filed.

Defendant Will E Edwards in court with attorney Michael Rud.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Rud in court.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-048

Defense counsel submits documentation to the court and statements on the record that defendant was recently hospitalized and requests adjourned initial appearance.  No objection by the State.

Court will order a stayed arrest warrant and orders case adjourned for initial appearance in Branch CCCR.
Clerk:  jms
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/11/15 @ 1:30 pm
